citations.narrative:
During a review of facility records, an incident was found involving the death of 4 chickens by a predator entering the
enclosure. On March 5th, 2025, the facility found a dead chicken in the chicken coop adjacent to the milking barn. The
following day (March 6), the facility found three additional chickens which had been killed in the same enclosure and
appeared to have been attacked by a predator. On March 8th, facility representatives observed a mink harassing the
chickens. At that point, the enclosure was surrounded by wire panels with 2" x 4" openings which could allow the entrance
of a small predator. After observing the mink, the remaining chickens were moved to a secure pen while smaller chicken
wire was added to the existing wire.
Enclosures that are constructed in a way that allows for predators or other unintended animals to enter the avian areas
can result in stress, injury, or death to the birds.
Correct by ensuring that housing facilities for birds are kept in good repair, protect the birds from injury, and restrict other
animals from entering that may negatively affect the welfare of the birds within.
Corrected prior to this inspection (04/24/2025).
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
